Jx.Store.Protocol

Extends: Jx.Object

Base class for all protocols.  Protocols are used for communication, primarily, in Jx.Store.  It may be possible to adapt them to be used in other places but that is not their intended function.

Summary
Jx.Store.ProtocolExtends: Jx.Object
Functions
readSupports reading data from a location.
insertSupports inserting data from a location.
updateSupports updating data at a location.
deleteSupports deleting data from a location.
abortused to abort any of the above methods (where practical).
combineRequeststests whether the protocol supports combining multiple records for a given operation

Functions

read

read: function()

Supports reading data from a location.  Abstract method that subclasses should implement.

Parameters

optionsoptional options for configuring the request

insert

insert: function()

Supports inserting data from a location.  Abstract method that subclasses should implement.

Parameters

datathe data to use in creating the record in the form of one or more Jx.Store.Record instances
optionsoptional options for configuring the request

update

update: function()

Supports updating data at a location.  Abstract method that subclasses should implement.

Parameters

datathe data to update (one or more Jx.Store.Record objects)
optionsoptional options for configuring the request

delete

"delete": function()

Supports deleting data from a location.  Abstract method that subclasses should implement.

Parameters

datathe data to update (one or more Jx.Store.Record objects)
optionsoptional options for configuring the request

abort

abort: function()

used to abort any of the above methods (where practical).  Abstract method that subclasses should implement.

combineRequests

combineRequests: function(op)

tests whether the protocol supports combining multiple records for a given operation

Parameter

operation{String} the operation to test for multiple record support

Returns {Boolean} true if the operation supports it, false otherwise

Base class for all other object in the JxLib framework.
